title.narrative: 4.1 INCREASED CAPACITY TO LEGISLATE, PLAN AND BUDGET FOR CHILDREN

description.narrative: 4.1 State institutions and other partners have increased capacity to legislate, plan and budget to prevent and respond to child protection concerns including during humanitarian situations

sector.narrative: Administrative data and Information Management System (IMS) including CPIMS+, GBVIMS+, MRMIMS+
Child Protection humanitarian AoR/humanitarian sector coordination
Legal and policy framework related to violence, exploitation and abuse
MRM - Child protection monitoring and reporting of grave violations in armed conflict (Security Council Resolutions 1612, 1882, 1888 and 1960)
Services to prevent or respond to violence, exploitation and abuse
Social welfare workforce systems strengthening (accreditation, staffing and supervision)
Technical assistance - Prevention and response services for violence against children
Violence, exploitation, and abuse - surveys (e.g. KAP, VACS), data analysis/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 4.1 State institutions and other partners have increased capacity to legislate, plan and budget to prevent and respond to child protection concerns including during humanitarian situations

description.narrative: Provisions for alternative care services have been made in the draft Rules Relating to Children, 2019 as mandated by the Act Relating to Children, 2018. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:13/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of children without parental or family care provided with appropriate alternative care arrangements [COVIDSitRep]

National case management system established with 6 required elements (includes referral pathways, standardized criteria and procedures, qualified social work force, defined roles for the relevant actors, formal best interest determination procedure, information management system)

Number of recommendations from the Child Protection Systems Mapping Report 2015 (66 recommendations) and child protection CRC concluding observation recommendations 2016 (32 specific recommendations) addressed by legislations, policies or plans
Number of children in residential care including faith based institutions
Child Protection sector information management system in place to regularly collect and analyse administrative data related to child protection

baseline.value: Not in place in any local level, province or federation

actual.value: 2019:Administrative data on child protection have been compiled and published by the National Child Rights Council; i.e. State of Children in Nepal Report 2019.

title.narrative: Protection cluster strategic work plan priority interventions included in government annual plan

actual.value: 2019:Priority interventions of the cluster are being implemented; child friendly spaces and other interventions were carried out in flood and tornado affected areas.

title.narrative: Child-sensitive national risk management plan addressing risks related to child protection in emergencies is in place
Existence of legislation that recognize children's right to be heard in civil and administrative proceedings that affect them (in line with Article 12 of the CRC)

Existence of legislation prohibiting all forms of corporal punishment of children, by setting (all settings, and by setting: home, schools, alternative care settings and day care, as a disciplinary measure in penal institutions/detention, and as a sentence for an offence)
